title: RESG Project Analyst - Real Estate Services Group
description:
As part of the Central Bank of the United States, the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston works to promote sound growth and financial stability in New England and the nation, and to ensure the integrity and efficiency of the country’s financial system. The Bank’s Real Estate Services Group (RESG) contributes to this mission by managing and maintaining the Bank’s real estate and related assets and providing both Bank staff and prestigious tenant firms with timely, effective, and cost-efficient building services through best business practices and innovative technology. RESG staff run the gamut from building engineers to space designers, project managers to business analysts. We believe our employees are our greatest asset.

We offer an enviable employee value proposition: in compensation; a comprehensive benefits package; a fully-funded pension plan and a 401k match, as well as tuition reimbursement and free membership in our state-of-the-art onsite fitness facility.

Job Summary

Reporting to the Business Services Manager, the Project Analyst plays an important role within RESG. The Project Analyst works closely with RESG’s Directors of Capital Projects and Facilities Operations and their teams to gain a holistic understanding of all building-related projects taking place, supporting these projects from start to finish. This will include, but is not limited to, tracking upcoming projects in the pipeline, submitting project specifications and other necessary documentation to FRB’s Procurement department and working closely with all involved to ensure the procurement process follows the set timelines, maintaining databases of contract information with vendors, and using that information to ensure that all invoices received are in line with contract terms. This role will also be required to provide project analytical support to the Project Managers and the Sr. Business Services Analyst, including project reports, project budget analysis, preparation of project updates to be provided to the Federal Reserve Board of Governors, project Gantt charts, energy project tracking (ROI, payback, incentive management), and other project-related tasks as needed.

Principal Accountabilities
Compile and execute all Requests for Proposals/Quotes (RFP/RFQs), Summary of Contract Terms (SCTs), Purchase Orders (POs), contract amendments, and all purchasing/procurement documentation for RESG’s Engineering and Operation units. Develop RFP/RFQs using scope of work provided and monitor entire procurement process to ensure RFP is bid within specified timeframe. Play key role as RESG liaison to Procurement Department. Track projects throughout the procurement life cycle and provide updates to management as needed.
Support procurement process by entering purchase requisitions into system, creating contract abstracts (SCTs), and requesting rate sheets from vendors as necessary. Maintain documentation for contracts, expenses, purchase orders, and invoices.
Work closely with Project Managers and RESG Senior Business Services Analyst to ensure project timelines and spend are in line with anticipated budget; make recommendations on updates to budget and timeline as needed.
Provide project updates to Directors of Building Operations and Capital and Engineering in the form of reports, PowerPoint presentations, and project Gantt charts as needed.
Review all RESG invoices for project-related work to ensure rates and scope of work are in line with contract terms. Investigate and resolve any inconsistencies in a timely manner to ensure prompt payment for vendors. Track invoice inconsistencies and issues for analysis.
Assist Senior Business Services Analyst with analysis of spending impacts on revenues, depreciation budgeting and forecasting, and other analysis as needed.
Other Accountabilities

Perform other duties, as assigned. Comply with all Bank and department policies and procedures.

Responsibilities And Qualifications
Assist with all Vista Outdoor Ocean freight

title: Loan Processing Assistant
description:
As a Loan Processor Assistant, you will be expected to demonstrate a sense of urgency, willingness to work closely with others, and be part of a team whose primary focus is service to our customers as you will be their main point of contact. This is a non-exempt Purpose: Support one or more high producing Loan Processors and serve as a contact point for all parties including Loan Officer, Borrower, Underwriters and Sales Agents. Gather information needed by Underwriting in order to decision loan applications. Essential Functions/Duties:1
Assist Loan Processors in validating assets and liabilities listed on the loan application by gathering information from third party resources(examples include obtaining bank statements to verify deposit balances and matching liabilities listed against credit reports). Validate additional information provided by loan applicant on the application (includingVerification of Employment, Verification of Deposits, flood certification, HMDA information, etc.)2
Assist Loan Processors in gathering documentation specifically required byFHA, VA, or USDA Rural Development for prospective customers applying for those loan programs in accordance with policies .and. procedures, register loans on the origination system.3
Assist Loan Processors with issuing proper disclosures as required by federal regulatory compliance and review rate locks and point objectives for accuracy, ensure overage and underage is approved as well as waiver of any fees. Set up files .and. order all necessary exhibits for appraisals and credit reports, check alternative documentation for accuracy and potential problems. Review flood and tax certificates and surveys noting all issue’s upon receipt, review all documents thoroughly to ensure they meet Bank ofEngland/ENG Lending's guidelines before submission to Underwriting.4
Assist Loan Processors in providing all required information to underwriters for loan decision - if additional information is needed, contact Loan Officer for needed information.5
Assist Loan Processors with refinance loan applications that are approved, request payoff information for all existing mortgage loans/liens.6
Assist Loan Processors in obtaining lists from underwriters of conditions necessary to close loan and work with Loan Officer to obtain necessary information in order for Loan Processor to submit to underwriter.7
Assist Loan Processors in verifying that all files receiving clear to close approval contain Title Commitment, Proof of Homeowners Insurance,Insured Closing Letter, Wiring Instructions and Tax Report.8
Assist Loan Processors in generating documents and maintaining logs to ensure complete and accurate compliance with RESPA, Regulation Z, FairLending, HMDA, Bank Secrecy Act and other regulations regarding the mortgage application/origination process. Understand and comply with mortgage industry regulations, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act, the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act, the Community Reinvestment Act,Truth-in-Lending laws, etc.9
Protect Company's reputation and image by maintaining Borrower confidence; deliver a high level of customer service and by keeping mortgage loan information confidential.10
Work as directed by Management.11
Honesty and integrity in dealing with others and accountability in standing behind your work; initiative and self-motivation in serving the client, getting the job completed thoroughly and on time; ability to listen to others and understand their needs; confidence in yourself and enthusiasm regarding your service. Demonstrate organizational skills in havingt he ability to prioritize and manage numerous tasks at the same time.

title: Associate, Strategic Finance
description:
The Strategic Finance function at Built focuses on accelerating growth and delivering value-maximizing analysis / operational insights. On a daily basis, this team partners directly with Built's senior leadership to provide data-driven insights to inform strategic, financial, and operational decision-making across the company. This is a high-impact role that will offer senior leadership exposure and the opportunity to impact strategic decision making in a hyper-growth environment.

We are seeking a Strategic Finance Associate to help support our next phase of growth and become an integral part of the finance function at Built. This person will have a "builder" profile complimented by a passion for analytics, be inspired by technology business models and enjoy operating in hyper-growth organizations. This role will support and lead deep financial analysis, business forecasting, financial and business plan modeling, financial planning and risk management, capital allocation, and strategic planning.

This is an outstanding opportunity for an emerging leader with 2+ years of finance experience to join a company in hyper-growth mode and influence its financial strategy.

Fiduciary Mgmt & Business Partnership (Traditional)
Build, own, and refine sophisticated financial models and synthesize key outputs for executive decision making process
Support the management, division, and company-wide financial planning
Deliver proficient and consistent execution of key performance indicators and financial analysis
Develop sustainable, rigorous, and ongoing processes to support cross-functional decision making. 

Analytics Actualization (Advanced)
Support in the delivery of world-class SaaS benchmarking and developing / refining Built's unit economics
Support the management of Built's total P&L, establishing useful and creative executive reporting
Leverage subject-matter-experts across the organization to build and refine business cases
Assist in identifying high-level investments required including product development, marketing & other costs to evaluate P&L impact
Support development of stakeholder presentations to facilitate management discussions and articulate the company's strategic vision

Value Creation (Progressive)
Conduct in-depth analyses of our various businesses and develop deep understanding of key value drivers to identify improvement areas and opportunities
Assist with evaluation of financial feasibility and viability of new business opportunities, and provide suggestions for improvements to recurring projects (e.g. incorporation of new revenue streams, cost-cutting measures, etc.)
Bring clear thinking and excellent problem-solving skills to top issues facing the business and product organization
Assist with potential new partnership and transaction identification, evaluation, and negotiation, analyzing financials and preparing term sheets as needed

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Oregon State Treasury is recruiting for a part-time Financial Analyst. This position will work 20 hours per week.

The primary purpose of this position is to provide administrative, technical and confidential support to the Accounting Manager, other members of the Administrative Services team, and Treasury leadership utilizing advanced computer software. This position has responsibility for completing assignments received by the Accounting Manager and the Administrative Services management team, and makes decisions that may relate to highly sensitive/confidential matters.

Position Responsibilities
Works with a variety of databases from across multiple agencies, public databases from the federal government and other sources to conduct analysis.
Generates standard and custom reports summarizing business, financial, or economic data for review by management. Interprets data and analyzes results.
Prepares cash forecasts, revenue estimates and expenditure projections for planning purposes.
Determines budget execution guidelines and coordinates with the Lead Accountant to ensure proper implementation. Maintains budget execution records and coordinates with agency accounting to reconcile any differences.
Monitor revenue and expenditures during biennium to verify compliance with budget appropriations. Compile revenue and expenditure information. Update program budget appropriations or limitations from legislative Emergency Board approvals.
Reconciles accounts, initiates corrections, and makes adjusting entries. Makes or recommends changes to eliminate future reconciliation problems stemming from systems, processes, policies or procedures. Prepare and submit annual DAS Risk Management report.
Issue invoices to third party for reimbursement of employee travel. Process agency cash receipts. Review and reconcile daily receipts. Oversee, monitor and complete Accounts Receivable aging report.
Assists the Treasury Budget Analyst with preparing budget requests. Coordinates work with other fiscal analysts, accounting staff, and program managers. Work with management to assess program budgetary needs and develop budget narratives.
Balance revenue and expenditure histories and prepare current biennium estimates. Assist others to prepare budget rebalance plans for Emergency Board meetings and quarterly forecasts.

title: Wraparound Facilitator
description:
Under the direction of the Wraparound Program lead, the Wraparound Facilitator carries a caseload of children and/or adolescent and their families. The Wraparound Facilitator conducts weekly meetings with families to assess progress toward their goals and communicates progress or barriers to treatment to the referring party. The Wraparound Facilitator frequently communicates and consults with team members in developing and maintaining a Plan of Care and Crisis Safety Plan for families. He or she is well-versed in and is able to communicate to others the Wraparound philosophy, principles and process. The Wraparound Facilitator is responsible for completing all required documentation in accordance with agency and county standards.

Essential Functions
Responsiveness to the families’ identified needs.
Development of Family-centered help-giver skills.
Achievement of professional and Family partnerships.
Incorporation of informal supports, natural Family helpers, and other Community resources.
Outcomes for children and Families.
Feedback from children and Families Community services providers.
Carry a caseload of 10 cases comprised of children and/or adolescents and their families
Responsible for initial enrollments
Maintain contact with referring party and communicate family’s participation, progress or barriers to treatment
Collaborate with outside agencies to provide services needed for families
In collaboration with team members, create and maintain Plan of Care and Crisis Safety Plan for families
Conduct weekly meetings with families to assess their needs and progress toward goals
Maintain Wraparound chart in accordance with HIPAA, DMH and Los Angeles County standards
Complete and submit all required paperwork, notes and reports including but not limited to:
Department of Mental Health progress notes
daily contact notes
incident reports
suspected child abuse reports
monthly status reports
Available to respond to crisis 24 hours a day, 7 days a week
Respond to crisis and coordinate immediate intervention to stabilize family
Consult with team members and supervisor on a regular basis regarding caseload and appropriate course of action in crisis situations and incidents
Leads the individual Child Family Team by:
Following the four phases of Wraparound and all the activities identified
Ensuring the principles of Wraparound are adhered to by all team members
Ensuring that al the strengths and needs are identified
Ensuring all the identified services are provided in a timely and appropriate manner
Being the contact point for children, families, service providers and the Community
Ensuring the County representatives has adequate opportunities for input and access to the team and planning process
Assess the need to request flex funds and communicate need to immediate supervisor
Sensitive and responsive to the cultural differences among the agency’s client population
Actively participate in quality improvement projects

The Wraparound Facilitator will take on special projects or additional duties as assigned by the Wraparound Program Lead.

title: Audit Associate - Markets
description:
The Associate, Senior Auditor position is a staff role within the Internal Audit for the Americas function. It reports to either a VP, Audit Manager or a Director, Senior Audit Manager. The position is primarily responsible for completing quality work within assigned timeframes and budgets. This is generally the execution of assigned audits, including planning, fieldwork, reporting, and issue tracking and follow-up.

This position generally does not manage staff. Travel is required for the position, with an estimated range of 10-40% varying on the location of the incumbent and key staff and stakeholder and audit geographies.

Lead interviews of process owners to develop understanding of business processes, client’s business
Identify potential risks and controls, and assist in developing scope and work programs
Evaluate internal controls design and effectiveness
Identify control weaknesses and suggest appropriate remediation
Document results using appropriate business and technical language in workpaper system
Report findings and client issues to Portfolio Manager or Senior Portfolio Manager
Assist with workpaper review and report preparation

title: Municipal Bond Credit Analyst
description:
Clinton Investment Management has an opportunity for a Municipal Research Analyst who will gather, organize, analyze, and present relevant data in order to evaluate municipal credit risk for $1 billion of municipal assets under management. The analyst articulates to portfolio managers and clients the philosophy and viewpoints utilized in managing municipal credit risk in various types of strategies and portfolios, spanning sectors and across the risk spectrum. The analyst will also maintain information systems to accurately reflect current opinions regarding approved debt issuers.

Performs fundamental credit analysis for a complex portfolio of municipal issuers across the risk spectrum, including high yield.
Recommends, through written and verbal communication, suitability of municipal credits for individual portfolios and commingled funds.
Contributes to the advancement of the municipal research team though forward looking credit analysis, development and maintenance of models, advancement of team strategies, and strong communication with internal and external parties.
Establishes communication links with internal team members and portfolio managers as well as outside rating agencies, broker/dealer community and other industry players.
Ensures that portfolio control systems are maintained and updated on a continuous basis, and that assigned municipal credits and sectors are reviewed, analyzed, and documented to fulfill internal/external regulatory requirements.
Performs special analysis projects and supports Municipal Research team.

title: Quality Engineer
description:
The Quality Support Engineer (QSE) is a member of the Quality Engineering Organization. This individual has the operational tasks to implement, monitor and secure build quality in the production process through ensuring adherence to the Quality Operating System (QOS), related procedures, methods and tools in production areas. The QSE is responsible to lead & support production teams with problem solving analysis to enable build in quality and drive achievement of plant quality targets.

The QSE has the authority to evaluate not only adherence to, but effectiveness of the procedures, methods and tools utilized in production as required by the QOS. Likewise, The QSE has the authority to identify and mitigate risks in the production process by implementing temporary short term actions based on 4M analysis and escalating as required.

Responsibilities
Ensure adherence to implemented QOS procedures, methods and tools to guarantee built in quality
Monitor Adherence to and effectiveness of Control Plans / PFMEAs and drive resolution of non-conformances
Support the production teams to build quality in the production process with a focus on prevention
Support the production teams to secure quality target deployment at the team level (Act as Subject Matter Expert (SME) for Volvo Cars Manufacturing System (VCMS) Quality initiatives)
Facilitate Problem Solving Initiatives at the production team level with focus on 4M (Man, Method, Material, Machine)
Review internal indicators (data from in-process quality metrics such as various audits and inspection stations) to drive investigation and resolution of quality issues generated in the production process
Drive and follow-up on containment actions related to daily production issues or warranty issues
Supervise defined quality assurance activities with collaborative teams across many areas
Collaborate on new model activities related to Quality Built In initiatives driving quality into design

title: Manufacturing Engineer
description:
As a Manufacturing Engineer at Affera, you will support the development and launch of Affera’s class II and III medical devices from development through regulatory approval and commercial release. This is a high impact role, applying manufacturing and quality engineering principles to assist the R&D team in transitioning from the development stage through V&V in accordance with FDA QSR guidelines.

We are looking for bright individuals who are interested in making a difference in a dynamic and exciting entrepreneurial environment.

Responsibilities
Manufacturing process development for complex catheter assemblies containing miniature, precision electromechanical components.
Development of manufacturing documentation including: inspection, assembly and test procedures; purchase specifications; BOMs; routers; part and assembly drawings.
Management of documentation changes using appropriate change control procedures.
Design and development of jigs, fixtures and other equipment for catheter assembly, inspections and testing.
Implementation of material control procedures from material receipt through final assembly.
Management of laboratory and prototyping space and equipment.
Hands-on assembly and testing of devices to support development, pre-clinical and V&V activities.
Address quality issues, including issuing non-conformance reports and managing Corrective and Preventive Actions.
Use Design for Manufacturability (DFM) and statistical techniques to ensure the manufacturability and robustness of the product.
Participate in design reviews and assist with Design and Process Failure Mode and Effects Analyses (FMEA).
Interface with vendors including procuring materials, resolving issues and transferring processes to OEM vendors.
Train and supervise assembly and test technicians.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Looking for opportunities to use cutting edge technologies analyzing petabytes of data in a world class Hadoop cluster? Interested in generating analytical insights that inform provider networks and engagement strategies that support members on their individualized health and wellness journey? Aetna's Provider & Network Analytics team delivers strategically impactful programs and tools that expand convenient access to high-quality and affordable care for all members across multiple channels across all stages of life.

At Aetna, we’re pioneering a total approach to health and wellness. As a Data Scientist on the Analytics & Behavior Change team, you’ll build industry-leading analytics, data, and technology platforms to help re-imagine health care. This position will play a critical role within a cross-functional team, delivering powerful solutions that inform network strategy and design, improve network performance and provider engagement, develop new provider offerings, and enhance consumer experience. You will be part of a fast-paced, innovative, collaborative team, helping solve problems, drive impact, and deliver key insights to our customers by leveraging innovations in data science, machine & deep learning, and predictive modeling techniques. You will derive meaning from data and deploy robust solutions through provider-directed engagement channels (e.g., digital) that helps consumers identify affordable care, when they need it, and with whom.

Participates in the development, validation and delivery of algorithms, statistical models and reporting tools.
Solves moderately complex analytical problems.
Develops, validates and executes algorithms and predictive models to investigate problems, detect patterns and recommend solutions.
Explores, examines and interprets large volumes of data in various forms.
Performs analyses of structured and unstructured data to solve moderately complex business problems. utilizing advanced statistical techniques and mathematical analyses.
Develops data structures and pipelines to organize, collect and standardize data that helps generate insights and addresses reporting needs.
Uses data visualization techniques to effectively communicate analytical results and support business decisions.
Creates and evaluates the data needs of assigned projects and assures the integrity of the data.
Explores existing data and recommends additional sources of data for improvements.
Documents projects including business objectives, data gathering and processing, detailed set of results and analytical metrics.

title: Remote Mortgage Underwriter
description:
Candidates in this job are responsible for assessing the overall credit risk of loan transactions by thorough analysis of all loan components for residential loan applications. Components include but are not limited to: AUS decision report, credit report, all sources of income, type of loan, appraisal report, assets, debt to income ratios, occupancy, preliminary title report and fraud detail reports.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES
Ability to review all loan components in the file for completeness, accuracy and integrity while ensuring that documents are consistent and uphold to Company and industry guidelines. (i.e. Qualifying income used is supported by documentation provided; Appraised value used is supported by appraisal and supporting documentation)
Examine transaction and investor manual to ensure compliance with all investor guidelines.
Implement and enforce fraud detection techniques--Request supplemental information/documentation as necessity dictates.
Underwrite loan application within limits of credit authority based on capability to underwrite transactions involving varying levels of complexity and risk—Acquire a 2nd level underwriter when deemed necessary.
Recognize risk factors that may compromise the overall quality of the loan file.
Execute loan decisions and review loan conditions in a timely manner- Expected production level is 4 underwriting decisions per day.
Effectively communicate and engage proactively with loan agents, processors, funders and post-closers in regards to loan decisions, assignment of loan conditions, investor guidelines/documentation requirements and possible loan scenarios.
Recognize types of documentation required for varying or unique circumstances. (e.g. Self-Employed borrowers, title report issues, derogatory credit and non-traditional income sources, etc.)
Aid in the resolution of pre-purchase loan deficiencies by assisting the post-closing department in making necessary file corrections as well as retrieving loan suspense conditions.
Strong computer skills; Proficient with Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook

title: Inbound Logistics Coordinator
description:
Primary duty is to arrange, monitor and ensure timely delivery of frozen and refrigerated seafood cargo from country of origin to the U.S. or other markets, as needed. Using knowledge of U.S. Customs and FDA regulations ensures that shipments pass through U.S. Customs and complies with U.S. Food and Drug Administration regulations. This involves constant planning, monitoring, analyzing, prioritizing, and the ability to think quickly, and exercise good business judgment to handle issues as they arise. Provide administrative support to both inbound and outbound logistics by obtaining and reviewing all paperwork related to inventory prior to inputting data in company’s ERP. This position operates independently, with minimal general supervision, and regularly exercises discretion and independent judgment.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
Ensure that all shipments of product from international locations are properly cleared through Customs and FDA.
Collaborate with import vendors, set up shipment deliveries and verifies all import transactions comply with government regulations.
Monitors and maintains import records on all international shipments, including all U.S. Customs and FDA entry documents.
Arranges for and monitors the re‐exportation or destruction of FDA rejected product.
Selects custom brokers, as needed, to handle special situations.
Works with various Port Authorities to ensure security and efficient cargo flow.
Updates shipment information in current ERP system to ensure the most accurate delivery and arrival dates are communicated to cross functional teams.
Analyzes issues, provides proper course of action and implement solution.
Responds to all email warehouse requests for purchase order, stock transfer and return manifests.
Receives all inventory into ABS for A, G, and T divisions which includes verifying all information is correct for all product against purchase orders, stock transfers and work orders.
Ensures TTR information is attached to each container tally and shares this with the Quality Assurance team. Submit monthly TTR report to management.
Ensures necessary paperwork is attached in ABS for all receipts.
Assists in adjusting inventory whenever necessary.
Ensures stock transfers with claims are completed and debit memos are mailed in a timely manner.
Communicates with the various warehouses to follow up on transfer in storage requests and approvals.
Upon receipt of Canadian product, verifies the FDA/PAPS clearances and updates the same in ERP System.
Assist the Inbound Logistics Supervisor in reviewing all customs broker, ship lines and carrier invoices, and requests back up documents when necessary.
Other duties as may be assigned at the discretion of management.

title: Remote Customer Success Coach
description:
You could be a good fit for a JobStep Success Coach if you:
Are a fantastic writer who can draft great resumes and cover letters. Our automation tools will do a lot to customize resumes and cover letters but our customer success folks provide the base content
Have a knack for teasing out job seekers' translatable skills and helping them see the impact they've had in previous jobs. title: Manager, User Experience
description:
Working independently and strategically, the Manager, User Experience is responsible for conceptualizing, delivering and developing user experience for all digital channel. The Manager is responsible for driving the creative vision of customer experience journey, responsibility for identifying the UX strategy for omnichannel capability, Web site, or application. Comes up with ideas, thinks of possibilities, sets the direction for the design solution, works creatively with the product team to create the omnichannel capability roadmap.

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES*
Through thoughtful leadership and management of an experienced cross-functional user experience design and research team, drives design thinking and creativity to maintain a fresh and current approach to product and create an engaging customer experience journey, design/redesign, and development and support the GameStop strategic omnichannel roadmap and goals.
Leads the design vision and guide the UX team in its performance and day to day duties. The leader will also create the vision for consumer engagement through the execution of digital user products.
Review recommended designs and work of UX team members to ensure that designs are aligned company priorities, product roadmap, customer feedback and stakeholder’s business priorities.
Present complex design concepts by simplifying it, user needs, and design rationale to multidisciplinary teams, as well as to key stakeholders and business partners
Guides the analysis of user experience data and provides recommendations to address business needs
coaches and pairs with product team members (UX, engineering, and product management) across product teams to design solutions and share best practices
Lead imaginative processes of origination of new and redesigned products in concert with customer needs
Develop, implement and lead an effective and efficient user experience design lifecycle as well as manage key design projects, processes and performance reports, data and analysis
Develop methods and procedures for monitoring projects such as conducting user research & usability study
Actively partner with cross-functional teams from marketing, product, site merchandising, operations, and executive management

If you’re right for this position, you’ll make learning our systems and processes a top priority, and make delivering projects on time and under budget your mission, all while communicating frequently and clearly with stakeholders.

This position requires extensive teamwork experience as well as the ability to work through, and influence, every part of the organization as an ambassador for TCGplayer products. title: Research Associate/Associate Scientist– Immunology
description:
We are seeking an exceptional researcher for an exciting RNA therapeutics startup. As RA/Associate Scientist, you will evaluate candidate therapies for the treatment of cancer and autoimmune diseases. The ideal candidate is an immunologist with molecular and/or cellular training with experience using gain-of-function techniques (transgenes, gene therapy, gene editing) to engineer immune cells to create therapeutic candidates. The ideal candidate has at least a bachelor’s degree in an immunology-related field with relevant in vitro and in vivo laboratory experience in the pharmaceutical or biotech industry. They will be able to quickly learn and integrate new protocols into existing workflows, possess strong oral and written communication capabilities, demonstrate excellent collaboration and interpersonal skills, and be adept at problem solving in a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities

Expand our therapeutic pipeline by:

Evaluating oRNA constructs to express proteins of interest

Evaluating oRNA constructs and formulation in relevant human and animal cell lines

Evaluating oRNA constructs and formulations in in-house animal models

Develop functional and phenotypic in vitro and ex vivo immune assays with human/animal material under the supervision of a senior immunologist.

Design, plan, and execute scientific experiments under the supervision of a senior immunologist.

Generate, interpret, and analyze data with a sense of urgency.

Effectively communicate experimental plans and data; present to cross-functional R+D teams.

Maintain an electronic notebook record of performed studies.

Ability to solve technical problems in a logical and rationale manner.

Self-motivated, detail oriented, and manage multiple parallel laboratory activities; effectively manage time.

Contribute to a positive and exciting work environment, contributing to a strong, entrepreneurial and creative culture.

Cygnal is looking for a relationally-connected, nose-to-the-grindstone, highly-driven, results-oriented politico to join our political sales team in Washington, DC area.

Cygnal is a culture-obsessed, team-oriented, fail-and-learn, servant-leader, obsessively-innovative organization. We are passionate about helping our clients get more accurate research that is also affordable.

Other polling firms are doing the same thing they’ve always done, while Cygnal is bringing accuracy and clarity by creating new methodologies, new technologies, and new ways to improve campaign decision making, creating intelligence for action .

Cygnal is a technological leader in the survey research, predictive analytics, and polling industries.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
The Financial Analyst will be responsible for driving Cash Management initiatives, specifically Working Capital improvements aimed at increasing the scalability and automation of U.S. cash management operations. Responsibilities include managing liquidity and insurance renegotiations, improve bank related services, driving lower costs and decreasing risk through contract negotiations, increase interest income through optimization of bank account structure, mitigate risks in liquidity management, and improve overall controls and visibility.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
Management of daily activities related to the Cash management function, including working capital savings, cash projections, debt and interest income and expense
U.S. cash & liquidity management
Monitor daily cash position, ensuring efficient and timely execution of cash concentration and funding needs
Ensure adequate controls and compliance with corporate bank account management and disbursement policies
Maintain and update a daily cash forecast
Recommend and oversee borrowings/repayments under company’s credit facilities
Oversee bank account management, including opening, closing and maintenance of bank accounts as needed in support of global growth
Review and manage bank fees, work with banking partners to negotiate and evaluate products, services and pricing
Leverage treasury management system (and AR Cash Applications system) and available technology to identify and implement process improvements and efficiencies
Oversee accounting for all cash transactions
Oversee intercompany loans, calculation of intercompany interest, and intercompany settlements
Evaluate investment alternatives for excess cash, including monitoring of IC AR and AP balances
Daily, monthly and quarterly reporting related to cash balances, debt & liquidity, interest and other income/expense
Provide analysis and potential options for hedging strategies to manage foreign currency and interest rate risk
Assist Finance and support Sales team with enforcing receipt terms with significant customers, and dispute discounts taken when timely payment is not received
Assist Procurement team in updates and modifications to Vendor Master file driving WC savings
Assist team in establishing US sourcing policy

Vintun is seeking a forward-thinking Supply Chain Business Analyst to join our team in support of our Naval Supply Systems Command (NAVSUP) clients in the Mechanicsburg, PA area. The successful candidate will play a critical role in providing business analysis and program management support to aid in NAVSUP Cross Functional Team (CFT) activities. These activities include conducting Supply Chain Management research, gathering requirements, building recommendation, tracking actions items, creating reports/presentations, managing CFT meetings and meeting minutes. The ideal candidate will have experience with requirements gather, business analysis, and supply chain management. The candidate must be able to work in a fast-paced environment. Support a Supply Chain Management (SCM) Cross Functional Team governing integration activities and requirements for Navy SCM-Supply Operations (Afloat/Field)

Gather unique requirements from existing SCM work and conduct requirements reviews with legacy application stakeholders.
Understand end-user needs for both capability and technology for short-term and sustained product lifecycle management.
Conduct complete and unbiased review of existing product lifecycle activities.
Communicate / coordinate activities, findings, dependencies, and recommendations across CFTs.
Collaborate with functional, technical, and budget counterparts to support program management efforts.
Assist in the preparation of technical reports by researching, collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information.

title: Decarbonization & Grid Innovation Analyst
description:
Silicon Valley Clean Energy is seeking to hire a Decarbonization & Grid Innovation Analyst who works under the direction of the Director for Decarbonization & Grid Innovation to plan and design a platform and portfolio of programs to achieve SVCE goals. The focus areas of the program portfolio include mobility, the built environment and grid integration and innovation. In general, built environment programs will catalyze efficient electrification and reimagine energy use in the built environment; mobility programs will reduce emissions, electrify, and automate personal and commercial transport; and grid integration & innovation programs will enable demand-side flexibility for achieving high-penetration renewables. This position will focus primarily on built environment programs. Duties to include:
Carry out technology, policy, and economic analysis to support the planning, design, development, and evaluation of programs to support decarbonization and grid integration across SVCE service territory.
Work closely with the other teams (Power Supply, Account Services & Community Relations, Legislative & Regulatory Effectiveness) as needed throughout a program’s lifetime (design, development, implementation, evaluation, measurement, and verification).
Support integrated resource planning efforts.
Support the development of partnerships with local, state, and federal agencies, national laboratories, universities, businesses, start-ups, and non-profits to create opportunities for program funding, new program markets and more effective program design and implementation.
Support the development of applications in response to funding opportunities issued by the CPUC, CEC, BAAQMD, DOE, CARB, and other
Contribute to ongoing work with staff from member jurisdictions to support local climate action plans.
Support the development and implementation of SVCE’s overarching decarbonization roadmap.
Write staff reports and presentations for Board and Committee meetings.

title: Research Assistant II
description:
Uses their training in structural biology, biochemistry and molecular biology to design and execute experiments related to an NIH-sponsored research project in the lab. The Research Assistant is expected to excel in area of structural biology and biochemistry and is expected to learn new techniques to accomplish the research project.
Performs molecular biology and biochemistry analysis of mammalian RNA methyl transferase reactions, cloning of genes, protein expression in bacterial cells, protein purification, and biochemical and structural analysis. Basic biochemistry and molecular biology techniques are required.
Collects and assembles data for any type of oral or written presentation.
Develops scientific hypotheses related to ongoing work in the laboratory.
Designs experiments to test hypotheses.
Carries out or delegates procedures for experiments.
Analyzes results of experiments independently.
Prepares oral and written reports for the P.I. on research to include, but not limited to: coherently and effectively communicating our laboratory research by writing abstracts, manuscripts, grant proposals and data reports for grants and oral presentations with corresponding slide presentation for PI, local and national meetings.
Functions as the Radiation Safety Officer for the lab and maintains all radioactivity logs, performs site monitoring, ensures proper storage and disposal of all isotopes.
Assists in the training of students and staff in the lab. In particular, he helps to mentor many of the graduate students in the lab as well as teaching them new techniques.
Serves as the lab manager. Manages all laboratory supply ordering, reconciliation and compliance with the RACE office in regards to all orders. Aggressively searches for better pricing on all orders and maintains contact with representatives from all supply companies
Interacts with co-workers, visitors, and other staff consistent with the iSCORE values of Jefferson.

title: Research Data Scientist
description:
This job builds new analytical solutions which inform processes and operations at the heart of our advanced analytics capability. The incumbent designs, executes and synthesizes point analytics to support specific questions, programs or initiatives. The incumbent is a data-driven problem solver who understands and utilizes the Organization's strategies goals and processes to answer critical business and research questions by leveraging and synthesizing the large volume and variety of data available to them. Draws on tools and methods from statistics and machine learning to perform analysis, create predictive models, visualize data, and drive projects through to delivery. Continuously scans and tests new data sources, tools, and analytical techniques and partners with leading institutions and experts to contribute to our portfolio of next-generation analytic projects.

Essential Responsibilities
Work directly with diverse stakeholders to understand their questions, processes, programs and/ or initiatives, then identify how analytical solutions could help deliver value for them (e.g., more effective and/ or efficient processes, scientific insights). This includes leading on and being accountable for: outlining new use cases, estimating future impact, and identifying the necessary data elements to deliver the analytical solution to highly complex problems. Assemble that data set using knowledge of where the required data exist within the Organization's source data system, derived production sets or publicly available sources. Includes securing and overseeing appropriate access and documenting objectives, assumptions and processes. (20%)
Select and apply the appropriate advanced modeling/machine learning techniques to these data-sets to deliver insight, ensuring that the final analysis is well researched, accurate, and documented. This requires technical flexibility and substantial expertise in, and delivery of: analytical approaches, including regression models, tree-based learning, neural networks, clustering techniques, natural language processing, including final model selection and advising on future maintenance. (20%)
Consult with stakeholders to contextualize and translate the results of our analysis in an appropriate form for the project (e.g. actionable for the business, appropriate for scientific publication, appropriate for non-technical audience). This will include leading written reports, presentations and data visualizations, and draws clear lines between the high-level problem specifications, the analyses performed, and how the results link directly back to business or scientific objectives for highly complex problems. It requires the incumbent to demonstrate their depth of understanding of all areas of the industry, the data and the analytical methods through ongoing engagement with a range of audiences. (30%)
Plan, prepare and deliver, coordinating all elements of the analysis of highly complex problems in such a way that it is delivered on time, to a high standard and ready to implemented on a production basis (including dissemination through the Organization's user systems) or published/presented in a scientific venue. This includes identifying the best route to the planned deliverable (e.g. implementation, publication) and coordinating fellow data scientists and analysts to deliver larger projects. (20%)
Self-directed researching new analytical skills and approaches, building relationships internally and externally to transfer knowledge and maintain their position as subject matter experts (including a significant external profile such as presenting at / coordinating external events or publication in professional journals), coordinating fellow data scientists and analysts to guide analysis and deliver larger projects. (10%)
Other duties as assigned or requested.

title: Quality Engineer
description:
Specialty Resources is a global sourcing and inventory management company for precision components & specialty products. Our domestic and offshore partnered factories allow us to source and supply our customers with quality products at competitive prices. SRI can supply; precision machined components, stampings, bearings, castings & forgings, cold headed & powdered metal parts, electrical components, rubber & plastics, seals, gaskets, springs, sheet metal fabrication and fasteners.

This position supports engineering, manufacturing and Quality Assurance operations with a focus on Quality processes and manufacturing activity. This hands-on team member works directly with department Leadership and supplier factory teams in the management, development and enhancement of SRI’s Quality Management System. This Engineer develops, documents, implements and monitors production quality and manufacturing systems to assure processes yield high quality products per SRI and customer specifications. This role requires customer internal and external relationship building, partnering and interaction related to product quality in the areas of design review, quality and manufacturing systems development, corrective action and continual improvement.

Duties & Responsibilities
Support the implementation of SRI and customer manufacturing and quality requirements to assure error-proof processes include documented records and feedback systems enabling factories the ability to monitor, track and report production activity for continual improvement.
Evaluate and track supplier factory performance to determine action required for improvement.
Supports the activity to resolve customer product complaints related to supplier nonconformances.
Provide structure and discipline to assure quality systems provide repeatable control, are appropriate, adequate and practiced.
Performs and participates in the internal QMS audit program to assure long-term systems compliance.
Supports the generation of, reviews and approves PPAP documentation such as Control Plans, Process Flow Maps, FMEA, Inspection plans and techniques, GR&R & test requirements.
Conducts and supports problem investigations using CAPA processes and RCA tools and methodologies.
Supports training and department growth as requested by department leadership.

title: Vice President of Operations
description:
Oversees and manages the establishment of the Strategic Business Plan as it relates to the overall direction of the Company Operations, Materials, Facilities, and Engineering departments. Further, the Vice President - Operations is responsible for the directing the General Manager and related management personnel regarding day-to-day operations of the aforementioned departments ensuring the goals and objectives set in the Strategic Business Plan are met.

Essential Duties & Responsbilities

▪ Manages the review of Customer Contract and Purchase Order requirements and ensure the aforementioned departments can meet the requirements in the timeframe agreed upon by the Customer and the Company.

▪ Manages the review of departmental requirements on a regular basis and ensure resources are available when needed to meet the agreed upon commitments to Customers and Company established goals and objectives.

▪ Manages the establishment and maintains fiscal year budgets for the aforementioned departments.

▪ Manages the establishment and maintains performance metrics, tied to established goals and objectives, to ensure trends are managed in a proactive manner.

▪ Manages the establishment of regular review meetings with immediate staff addressing performance, equipment, schedule, budgets, etc.

▪ Manages the establishment and maintains departmental organizational charts and documented job descriptions for all employees working in the aforementioned departments.

▪ Assists in the development, implementation, and maintenance of established Quality Management System polices through documented procedures and work/form instructions for the aforementioned departments.

▪ Ensure all employees working in the aforementioned departments are properly trained and equipped to perform the job descriptions under which they are working.

Reasonable accommodations will be made for qualified individuals with disabilities so that they can perform the essential functions of the job.

▪ Assist the Internal Quality Auditing function by addressing corrective action requests in a positive and timely manner.

▪ Support the Strategic Development Department in establishing and maintaining Continuous Improvement initiatives.

▪ Participate and chair when necessary regularly scheduled executive management meetings.

▪ Other duties may be assigned.

title: Gameplay Engineer - C++
description:
We are looking for a talented Gameplay Engineer to join the World Content Development team working on the next big AAA shooter experience. As a Gameplay Engineer, you'll focus on close collaboration with a team of environment artists, gameplay designers, and level designers to build out the player experiences in our upcoming title.

Our content engineering team is a team of skilled generalists, and our mandate is to bring the vision of our content creators to life in ways that are stable, scalable, performant and re-usable. The focus of the role will be on implementation of both high-level gameplay systems and specific gameplay experiences in a combination of C++ and Lua.

Candidates should expect to work across a range of technologies to fit the needs of the team - and all candidates should be comfortable diving into and working in lower-level engine code in order to debug any problems that might arise during day to day development. The ideal candidate will enjoy working in a highly collaborative environment, and will need to have both solid technical and communication skills.

Responsibilities
Work closely with designers and level artists to iterate daily on gameplay experiences
Develop deep understanding of our high-level gameplay and scripting systems
Provide scalable and re-usable solutions for a variety of gameplay problems
Work with other engineers to review and evaluate script architecture and system designs
Improve existing systems that aren't performing to required standard
Investigate complex issues arising in the engine, underlying script
Consider user impact features for designers and artists when designing low-level systems and features

description:
Digital Marketing Associates serve at the intersection of our customers and technology. As a Digital Marketing Associate, you will work on either the Digital Marketing or Content Operations teams. In this role, you will be working on critical projects to support our businesses by analyzing data; creating insights; developing, executing, and planning marketing campaigns on behalf of our parent and teacher audiences.

The ideal candidate for this role requires strong communication skills, the ability to manage project scope and deadlines, and a commitment to delivering the highest quality in all projects. Being analytically minded, detail oriented, creative and passionate about making a difference is a must for this role. Candidates recognize that a collaborative mindset and a “can do” attitude is key in order to learn, contribute and grow at Scholastic.

Your Responsibilities

Teams
Digital Marketing: The digital marketing team works to reach our parent and teacher customers across a wide array of owned, earned, and paid channels. As an associate on this team, you will help ensure that the needs of the business and customers are being met by following a campaign from ideation through execution. Associates on the product team proactively seek to understand each division’s business objectives and how they fit into the overall business strategy. They also serve as a contributing member of the digital marketing team, helping to do competitive analysis, understand our position relative to other campaigns in the market, monitor campaigns for KPI performance and optimization, launch A/B and proof-of-concept tests, and have a technical understanding of all our running feeds.
Content Operations: The content operations team reaches customers daily through innovative content across many digital marketing channels. As an associate on this team, you will be responsible for producing best-in-class content for Scholastic’s parent and educator audience. This position plays a vital role in supporting eCommerce functions. The Content Operations team also serves our business units’ content needs and supports various company initiatives.

title: Manufacturing Engineer
description:
This Manufacturing Engineer position will serve as a lean practitioner, and as such will be responsible for eliminating waste and improving business efficiency through the execution & promotion of lean methodologies & tools. This position supports Operational Excellence by executing projects and Kaizens tied to key strategic initiatives, and executes the Yellow Belt and hourly lean training programs so that those trained and certified are more able to effectively solve problems in their daily work using Kaizen and lean as a structure.

This position is aligned with the needs of the business in order to address the most important issues with the highest impact to the organization.

LSS, OPEX, TQM Strategy 
Supporting role in developing, communicating, and implementing the NAO Lean Six Sigma (LSS), Operational Excellence (OPEX), and Total Quality Management (TQM) strategy
Creates, maintains, and promotes LSS, OPEX, and TQM standards across the organization
Execution of operations strategy aligned with LSS, OPEX, and TQM standardsLead value stream mapping efforts to drive improvement strategies

Active role in setting the site Kaizen and project plan to attack highest impact projects and Kaizens in alignment with site lead
Leadership and execution of Kaizen activities and events that have a high impact to the site and corporate-level KPIs
Coordinate in the design and development of new manufacturing processes, systems, equipment, and materials to improve flow, reduce waste, and decrease variation
Recommend design changes to maximize economical manufacturing

Project Completion 
Lead the most important cross-functional projects that have high potential returns and major process improvements, and are tied to key strategic initiatives and operations strategy for the organization
Accurate analysis of project and Kaizen benefits ($) that can be tracked and supported by finance
Analysis of time and motion, methods, estimating, process engineering and plant layout to ensure balanced methods and available capacity to meet customer demand

Execute a training strategy to support problem-solving and Operational Excellence throughout the organization
Lead, co-lead Yellow Belt training
Lead, co-lead hourly lean training
Ensure on-going proper use of tools through training and certification
Identify and execute training and tool improvements to improve Kaizen, project, and belt quality and efficiency

Mines for and integrates data from multiple, and varied sources, and applies business rules for the purpose of creating analytic data sets. title: Research Assistant
description:
The Department of Basic Sciences’ mission is to provide quality preclinical education for medical students, to educate and train graduate and undergraduate biomedical scientists, to carry out basic research of recognized excellence, and to participate in governance and leadership in the College of Osteopathic Medicine at NYIT and in appropriate national scientific and professional societies.

We are seeking a part time Research Assistant at the Arkansas campus (NYITCOM at A-State) to assist in the laboratory research. The main research interest of our laboratory is to understand the role of osteopathic manipulative medicine in treating migraine using rodent models of headache. Both in vitro and in invo techniques will be adopted to address scientific questions.

The ideal Research Assistant candidate should have experience in biomedical research. Hands-on experience with handling live animals is a plus.

Duties And Responsibilities
Assist principal investigator in execution of experiments, data collection and analysis, and maintain experimental records.
Perform in vivo studies in rats and mice – rodent handling, performing injections in live animals and behavioral testing.
Perform in vitro studies using tissues and cells – immunohistochemical and immunocytochemical staining and microscopy, ELISA, Western Blot, etc.
Handle general lab maintenance and ordering.

title: Sr Population Health Analyst
description:
We are hiring a Senior Population Health Analyst on the Health Economics and Clinical Outcomes team to support Ascension’s Population Health Management Strategy and Programs. In this position, you will be involved in designing analytics and reporting to assess and monitor trends in the overall health and well-being of the populations we serve. You will be expected to work with data management teams to compile datasets from a variety of sources to provide a comprehensive picture of health risks and consult with Population Health Management leaders on areas of opportunity. Your work will directly impact population health outcomes by identifying and prioritizing people for enrollment in Population Health Management Programs. To be successful, you will need to leverage published clinical research and collaborate with clinical teams to define population health measures. You will apply logic to various data sources to develop metrics and report on risks across multiple domains including preventive care, social determinants of health, modifiable behaviors and chronic disease burden. As a liaison between analytics and population health management teams, you will need to have expertise in creating customer-facing reports and self-service visualizations.

Responsibilities:
Design and manage population health assessment reporting for a variety of populations including patients served by our physician-led national provider organization (Ascension Medical Group) as well as our value-based contracts.
Apply appropriate statistical methods to cross sectional and longitudinal data to describe changes in population health risks over time including benchmarks for comparison.
Work with data management teams to develop standardized datasets used for population assessment reporting.
Identify opportunities for optimal clinical and utilization impact and work with Care Management teams to operationalize patient identification for enrollment in population health management programs.
Create publication-quality graphical and narrative representations of work products.
Work with Quality teams to meet NCQA and URAC population assessment reporting requirements.

title: Quantitative and Data Analytics Graduate Intern
description:
Graduate students are placed in leadership roles within our internship program and provided with 4 days of professional leadership, project management, and people management training over the course of their internship. We consider our interns to be our company’s future leaders and strive to develop in them a solid foundation in servant leadership.

PenFed’s Internship Program offers college students with a meaningful internship experience from which they can make informed future career decisions. Our internships are meant to provide a great test drive of our company, industry, and of a potential career field. Interns are fully integrated into our business departments across the entire enterprise and assigned to meaningful and impactful projects solving real business problems faced by our company. Each intern is assigned a hiring manager and a mentor along with an employee who was a recent intern. In addition to the work our interns do within their respective departments, our interns will all work together on one large impactful summer internship project.

The PenFed Summer College Internship Program is a competitive, nine-week program that provides college students hands-on business education and skills development. The program includes professional leadership development, personality assessments, executive presentations and interaction, team building events, volunteering, career readiness training, social media training, mentoring, and meaningful work related to desired career paths that solve real world business problems. Qualified interns who prove themselves to be valuable additions to the PenFed Team could receive a full-time offer at the end of the program!

Responsibilities

What you could do during your 9 weeks:
Support quantitative risk modeling and analytics teams through data preparation, data and statistical analysis, and model output assessment
Assist with research product opportunities and reports
Verifying availability and relationship of variables
Work on model improvements
Vulnerability management assessment
Interpret results of analysis, present recommendations, alternatives and implications
Work with creative and driven professionals
Work on an exciting group intern project

title: Media Planner
description:
The Media Planner supports in the development of effective, innovative, and strategic solutions and is responsible for the day-to-day coordination and execution of approved media plans. Reports directly to the Media Supervisor.

Essential Functions

Account & Client Management
Produces work that delivers on client goals and gains industry recognition for its creativity and results. Constantly seeks and creates creative opportunities in both media choice and usage to increase visibility/impact.
Responsible for day-to-day maintenance of assigned accounts (billing issues, budget revisions, flowchart updating, competitive analyses, post-buy analyses, etc.). Maintains detailed and accurate records. Monitors media agreements and contracts with outside media vendors.
Contributes to the development and direction of media strategies and POV’s. Conducts media research, brainstorms, evaluates data, and develops points of view. Understands various media and their applications against client strategies and goals.
Maintains thorough, up-to-date knowledge of client’s business (market share, business priorities, key competitor strategies, etc.).
Communicates effectively with Media Supervisor, keeping him/her abreast of day-to-day status and flagging and elevating any concerns.

Vendor & Media Evaluation
Owns communication with both internal (buying teams and specialists) and external resources (publications, websites, etc.), to gather and negotiate costs and plan details. Evaluates partners for their relevance in accomplishing client’s strategic goals.
Evaluates inventory against audience segments for a range of media vehicles (display, video, mobile, paid social, native) to determine which would most effectively reach target audience.
Studies demographic data/consumer profiles to identify desired target audiences for online advertising.
Calculates campaign forecast/projected results, reach and frequency of potential media vehicles.
Stays abreast of key developments/trends/issues in media (e.g., population, demographic, lifestyle, media usage changes).
Maintains effective relationships with media vendors, ensuring Noble People is represented in a positive way.

Campaign Execution & Maintenance
Monitors campaign timelines to ensure proper progression of media buys, such as timely issuance and receipt of client authorizations, delivery of paperwork to vendors, specs to creative agencies, delivery of creative assets to vendors, etc.
Responsible for the preparation of insertion orders and placement of advertising with media vehicles.
Using multiple sources of external data, perform campaign analysis directly relevant to, and to assist in, optimizations, planning, and/or buying decisions.
Implements, traffics, troubleshoots, and analyzes digital campaigns using a third party ad server.
Monitors media for pacing, delivery, placement, and flight-date discrepancies and negotiates credit or billing adjustments when necessary.
Mentors and delegates to Assistant Media Planners on daily tasks in order to grow the Assistant’s knowledge base and expand individual management skills.

title: Operations Analyst - Global Trade
description:
Our client, a Fortune 100 global leader in the financial services industry, is hiring a Business Controls Specialist with experience in Global Trade to join their team in Charlotte, NC.

The Manager is seeking a candidate with experience in Trade Finance, for example: Letter of Credit, Stand-by, Bankers Acceptance, Trade Loan, etc.

Global Trade-Exposure Management (GTEM) is the central global resource for Trade Finance limit allocation related activity.

GTEM Risk Specialists manage the allocation and monitoring process for over 800 trade finance facilities for correspondent banks in 83 countries. Due to the ever changing trends in trade business, new control procedures continue to be developed within this function to ensure trade finance risks are mitigated.

Such development is coordinated with Credit Management, Trade Product and simultaneously seeks to facilitate objectives of FI Relationship Managers. Thus GTEM serves as a central clearing house allocating limits to booking units and ensuring trade finance facility usages/pricing are appropriate for the risk reward along with advising management on complex issues and business analyses

Job Responsibilities
Provide efficient turnaround on requests for correspondent bank credit approval on trade transactions
Develop and deepen relationships with internal clients and business partners in a professional manner
Implement transaction pricing in conjunction with authorized approvers to ensure TFF usage and pricing is appropriate for the risk reward
Facilitate GTEM system database updates on limits and pricing
Identify issues and initiate enhancement requests to support changing business requirement
Digest complex issues and develop creative solutions.
Provide routine and ad-hoc reporting to support trade in managing and growing the business
Perform reconciliation of data between different system of records

IMPAQ is seeking a policy analyst that demonstrates policy analysis, program implementation and project management skills. Manage and support the development and implementation of project schedules, plans, goals, and budgets with limited supervision of more senior staff.

Proactively identify ideas for innovation and process improvement.
Participate in business development activities, including writing technical responses and participating in federal and state capture planning activities.

title: Health Care Privacy Analyst
description:
The 3M Health Care Privacy Program Manager will contribute to the establishment of a privacy program to support the Health Care Business Group of 3M. The Health Care Privacy Analyst develops policies and procedures for handling sensitive health information, inventories and maps sensitive data flows, and identifies privacy risks where 3M collects health data across the globe. The Health Care Privacy Program Manager is a global role with emphasis on building a privacy program that addresses international privacy compliance requirements.
Primary Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:
Integrates divisional compliance plans into a Health Care Business Group strategy for measuring and monitoring compliance with key privacy requirements globally.
Conducts privacy assessments across 3M Health Care Business Group’s divisions and products lines.
Develops sensitive health information inventory and collects key attributes needed for tracking and reporting.
Identifies global compliance requirements for sensitive health information and develops strategies for compliance.
Develops training programs, awareness campaigns, and guidance for 3M’s Health Care Business Group addressing key requirements for handling sensitive health information.
Manages workforce requirements to ensure the 3M Health Care Business Group adheres to key data protection controls when handling sensitive health information.
Develops privacy policies, standards, and procedures for handling sensitive health information.
Conducts reporting and compliance monitoring across the 3M Health Care Business Group to ensure leadership has visibility into key performance indicators of compliance program effectiveness.
Participates in incident response process to ensure all regulatory and customer requirements are met in the event of a security incident.
Implements processes to ensure uses of sensitive health information are permissible and appropriate.
Complying with corporate policies and procedures while acting in a manner consistent with 3M’s values and ethical standards

title: Sourcing Procurement Manager
description:
Reporting to the VP of Operations, the Procurement Manager will Lead the sourcing for both direct & indirect materials & services for our organization which both manufacturers in-house and also utilizes a network of co-packer relationships to produce a diversified portfolio of finished goods offerings to our customers. Manage supplier relationships; align priorities with internal stakeholders; continuously seek opportunities to identify & recommend plans to mitigate risk, challenge our suppliers to assist in driving operational efficiencies through innovative thought & waste reduction.

Leverages spend across all categories, ensuring materials meet all aspects of consumer/customer/stakeholder expectations
Challenges suppliers to provide alternative product specifications that will meet the need while simultaneously driving out cost

Develop, monitor, manage and report on KPI’s for agreed-upon categories and/or supplier performance

title: Remote Benefits Representative
description:
Our client is looking for a Benefits Services Representative to be a licensed member of their Client Advocate Center. Benefits Services Representative is part of the inbound call queue and provides telephone support and advocacy for clients needing support in Spanish or English. A current life/health license is required, as many of the calls are questions regarding coverage & benefits support or claims issues. The Benefits Services Representative is handling these calls as an extension of the services provided by the group’s assigned benefits consultant, and should function in lock-step with the consultant to keep him or her apprised of any challenges that could impact client retention. They may process or correct member level eligibility requests and also provides claims and billing support, while ensuring timely execution and compliance with company policy and federal/state law. They will be tasked with driving results from carriers and holding them accountable for meeting established deadlines. The Benefits Services Representative will also be responsible for handling other ancillary requests including but not limited to address changes, ID card requests, summary of benefits requests, rate questions, etc. As matters arise that may require involvement from other functional areas both with out client as well as with carriers, broker partners and vendor partners, the Benefits Services Representative works to involve the appropriate parties and coordinates responses to ensure the client receives a prompt resolution to their issue.

Job Duties
Provide outstanding service to internal/external customers concerning their enrollment needs, and ancillary questions via phone (inbound and outbound), fax, chat, email or face-to-face contact.
Scrubbing/processing individual applications, termination forms and change requests for required information, then submitting items to carrier via email, fax, phone or online.
Contacting the client or consultant for additional information in a timely manner consistent with documented process.
Following up with the carrier to obtain status updates and providing updates to clients accordingly.
Thorough documentation of all calls/emails, work effort and related problem resolution in the group service tickets in CRM.
Assisting clients with claims and billing discrepancy resolution.
Strong, professional communication skills with both internal and external clients.
Production volume and accuracy of work are at consistently high standards.
Ensures the protection and security of a consumer’s personal, confidential and identifiable information in a professional and responsible manner, according to the standards and requirements of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA).
Re-certify HIPAA compliance annually or as directed by management.
Contributes to overall team goals and objectives through team participation and the sharing of individual skills and strengths.
Other duties as requested or assigned.

title: Consulting Analyst
description:
We are seeking a consulting analyst who is passionate about business process analysis and the intellectual challenge that it offers. The person we seek has previous experience in successful analysis roles performing strategic analysis. The analyst will support our consulting staff by performing analysis on client data and assisting with the development, implementation and integration of pioneering solutions using different methods, techniques and tools. You will ensure the rigor and underlying logic of the team's findings, optimize the analytical storyline and develop superior, easy to comprehend documentation and Power BI dashboards. 
 
The consulting analyst will be responsible for gathering, analyzing and documenting business processes, developing business cases, developing BI dashboards and providing domain knowledge to the team. This position will occasionally require travel to client projects depending on demand - up to 25% travel in North America. 
 
Simultaneously, you will help senior management further standardize the consulting tasks and related work product with the objectives of: reducing analytical cycle time, lowering field labor costs and reducing document rework and editing. As you become more familiar with our templates, you will also contribute to the refinement and extension of our findings and tools database/website which includes benchmarks, best practices and thousands of business process maps.

title: Business Associate
description:
The Business Associate in cooperation with members of the patient care team achieves desired outcomes in the following areas: Service Excellence, collaboration and teamwork, technical expertise, positive impact and problem solving. Additional activities may be at the request of the department and/or Manager to ensure safe effective and efficient operations of the facility.
Patient and family centered care (PFCC) at BH is demonstrated by working with patients and their families based on the 4 principles of PFCC: participation, dignity, and respect, information sharing, and collaboration. This includes providing service excellence by creating a great "First Impression" by demonstrating exemplary customer service skills for all customer groups including patients, families/friends, physicians, staff, and support department personnel. Adheres to the "Is there anything else I can do for you , and "Heal me, cause me no harm, treat me nicely" customer service pledge and promotes a positive work environment.

EEO/AA/Disability/Veteran

Service Excellence - Creates a great "First Impression" by demonstrating exemplary customer service skills for all customer groups including patients, families/friends, physicians, staff and support department personnel. 2.1 Demonstrates sensitivity to the varying needs and communication styles of our culturally diverse patients, families and staff.
