3.1 Receives, distributes, processes, files and maintains all patients' medical records and other documents relating to medical status and patient care maintaining strict confidentiality at all times.
4. Positive Impact on Practice/Problem Solving - Exhibits behaviors demonstrating responsibility for creating a positive work environment. Recommend reasonable solutions to address problems.
4.1 Ensure environment is always regulatory ready, regulatory compliant, including maintaining a clean, comfortable environment for patients, families, friends and coworkers.

The Protein Chemistry department at *** is looking for a versatile, skilled Research Associate I/II to join the team. We seek a highly organized and collaborative protein scientist to purify and characterize complex therapeutic antibodies.

Candidates will perform antibody purification and characterization using diverse techniques. title: Scientist II, Discovery Science
description:
We are seeking a scientist to work on our Discovery Science team and contribute directly to our drug discovery programs. The ideal candidate is an experienced biomedical researcher with broad knowledge of pharmacology, cell biology, and omics who is interested in harnessing that knowledge towards discovering novel treatments for a wide diversity of diseases.

TwoXAR Is An Artificial Intelligence-driven Drug Discovery Company

We leverage our computational platform to identify promising drug candidates, validate and de-risk them through preclinical studies, and progress remaining candidates to the clinic through industry and investor partnerships. We have established collaborations with leading biopharmaceutical companies and are now scaling the business and building our internal drug pipeline. twoXAR is venture-backed with financing from SoftBank Ventures and Andreessen Horowitz and has strong ties to Stanford University and MIT. Our management team and advisory board have decades of biopharmaceutical management experience, built software systems used by tens of millions of people, held VP and C-level positions at Fortune 100 companies, and have had previous startups end with successful strategic acquisitions.

Responsibilities Include
Utilize our proprietary AI-driven software to rapidly build computational disease models. This includes:
inspecting and annotating disease-specific biomedical data (e.g. omics, EMR, and clinical trials data)
using our AI-augmented annotation processes to properly define our disease of interest
running and carefully evaluating the results of our analysis algorithms
Examine and prioritize predicted drug discovery hits identified by our proprietary, AI-platform in a range of diseases, including oncology, immunology, and fibrosis.
Perform extensive literature and data review of drug discovery hits:
investigate potential mechanisms specific to the disease of interest
compare MoAs to preclinically or clinically tested MoAs to evaluate novelty
evaluate DMPK data to verify a molecule’s suitability for preclinical testing
Effectively communicate (written and verbal) and defend research internally

title: Transportation & Logistics Specialist
description:
As a Transportation Specialist at CONMED you will be the site single point of contact and subject matter expert for tranportation in Largo, FL! You will be responsible for finished goods shipments to and from Chihuahua, Mexico/ Largo, Florida/ Utica, New York with accountability for shipment compliance and cost savings initiatives. You will ensure timely deliveries of finished goods to our CDC and other locations within North America as well as to customers as needed. You will support the transportation of raw materials from suppliers in multiple geographies. You will escalate issues with 3PLs and other partners to ensure timely deliveries. In this role, you will report directly into the Corporate Transportation & Logistics Leader and indirectly into the Largo, FL Site Leader.
What You'll Do
Execute CONMED transportation strategy to include management of inbound and outbound lanes for Chihuahua, Largo or Utica.
Manage day to day shipments.
Route freight (all modes) according to corporate guidelines.
Ensure compliance to transportation guidelines and trade compliance.
Cost analysis.
Constant review of current lanes and assessment of consolidation opportunities.
Oversee freight audit and payment process and reporting.
Manage claims processes, reporting and training.
Develop - together with the Transportation Center of Excellence - programs to reduce transportation costs and create efficiencies within the network.
Develop strong relationships with stakeholders and key players in all US facilities.
Proactively research and report on trends and industry changes and make recommendations.
Perform other tasks as assigned by the Transportation Manager.
Develop strong relationships with service providers.
Audit invoices from carriers for lanes under his or her responsibility.
Be a dispatcher (receiving and transmitting information to coordinate vehicle movements) unless a designated dispatcher is appointed.

title: eCommerce Category Manager
description:
From our retail stores and our network of Distribution Centers to our Corporate offices, you'll work with others who share your values and commitment. We seek individuals who are passionate about animal welfare, have great people skills and are driven to grow and advance in their careers with us. Our ongoing growth is creating exceptional opportunities for professional development and personal enrichment throughout our organization.

Position Purpose

The Category Manager is the business owner of their assigned categories for the online Petco digital properties. The role is a critical component to align to the overall category strategy put forth by the retail merchandising partner, developing initiatives for online channels and managing the execution of events including launching new merchandise, optimizing navigation and search and enabling a superior digital customer experience for Petco desktop, mobile and tablet customers.

Essential Job Functions

The incumbent must be able to perform all of the following duties and responsibilities with or without a reasonable accommodation.
Responsible for online sales and profitability for assigned categories which align with retail merchandising partners overall strategies for eCommerce and total enterprise goals.
Demonstrating a passion and leadership competency for data-driven decision making for site placement and promotional planning, executing and optimizing website content to deliver on marketing and merchandising business objectives
Accountable for ownership and delivery of weekly site-wide and category plans including product placement and promotional approach; analyzing site/category offers to determine effectiveness and opportunity
Implement strategies which focus on key online channel conversion drives, optimal site presentation and drives multi-channel efforts. Responsibilities include but are not limited to optimizing conversion at page and category levels, site placement, product content, site search and navigation.
Create and nurture a “shared-vision” environment of collaboration, partnership and open discussion with direct reports and other Petco team members and stakeholders, both internal and external, that establishes and communicates clear and realistic goals, objectives and functional roles and are aligned with the category(s) strategic plan; use objective means to monitor progress toward those goals; effectively coordinate team members in order to meet timelines.
Conduct research on products, merchandise, customer trends and market factors, utilizing the category review process and online analytic tools to identify key factors affecting the performance of assigned category(s);
Collaborate with cross-functional teams in creating, developing and implementing financial models which manage assortment analysis and planning, product mix, pricing and, gross margin.
Create and execute online plans and promotions with eCommerce Director which drive and increase traffic, sales and expand profit margins consistent with total eCommerce goals.
Analyze sales and site funnel data to determine customer engagement by category, online channel and page level information.
Have a deep knowledge of ecommerce best practices including competitive strategies, marketing, usability testing and industry trends.
Ensure all activities comply and are conducted in accordance with international, federal, state and local laws, regulations and ordinances; remain cognizant of planned/proposed changes to same.
Interact professionally and effectively through verbal and written communication with all professional contacts with emphasis on company interests. Perform other related duties, tasks and responsibilities as required, assigned and directed.

Supervisory Responsibility

May direct and manage a small staff comprised of merchandising associates. Responsibilities include recruiting, interviewing, hiring, training, mentoring/coaching, providing functional guidance, assignment delegation and follow-through, and, partnering with Human Resources, discipline up to and including termination. Other management tasks include, but are not limited to, providing input and direction on such topics as key goals and objectives; strategic and tactical planning, implementation and execution; budgetary issues; capital expenditures and associate management, training and development. Additionally, this position will lead a cross-functional team over which it does not have direct administrative authority. This position is expected to independently lead these teams through the successful development and execution of strategic plans and tactical imperatives to support the business plan for the assigned category(s).

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
The ideal candidate will possess prior government contracting experience in human resources and recruiting. The Human Resources Manager has responsibility over the human resources and recruiting activities for assigned projects and must have demonstrated ability to plan, direct and coordinate all human resources activities. 

This role will partner with business leaders to develop and execute HR strategies focused on workforce planning and employee engagement.

During COVID-19 this position may be remote and continue remote for an extended period.

·      Work with Payroll, Benefits and IT departments on related matters for assigned projects/contracts.

title: Financial Planning Analyst
description:
The company is experiencing significant growth, and is now looking for a Financial Planning and Analysis Analyst to support that growth through strategic analysis and financial modeling. In this role you will interface with various leaders in the organization including Sales, Operations, Accounting, and Technology.  You will work closely with the CFO and the Accounting Team to support planning, forecasting, financial reporting, and financial analysis. A successful candidate will bring to the team strong analytical thinking, leadership, integrity, and excellent communication and management skills. The key responsibilities of the role include preparing strategic models, monthly forecasts, budgets and variance analyses, and supporting M&A diligence.  This role reports directly to the CFO. 

What you will do: 
Develop and maintain the Company's financial models 
Lead the annual budgeting process and monthly reforecasting processes  
Prepare and distribute Budget Variance reports and analyze and present key drivers of variances vs. plan  
Participate in Monthly Close Process  
Support financial and strategic analysis for M&A  
Competitive market analysis 
Serve as the Finance team’s lead on all pricing analysis and decision making 
Design and publish regular and ad hoc reports, dashboards, and analysis of KPIs to help drive business results 
Prepare presentations for Board and Senior Management 
Perform other financial analyses, tasks and assignments as needed.

The Regional Director of Operations will oversee a portfolio of 6-10 conventional multifamily communities. Our communities range in size and will be a combination of Class A & B assets.This position is remote, but will require travel.

As the Regional Director of Operations, your mission is to provide solid leadership to the assigned portfolio while demanding superior performance, placing an emphasis on results, while developing all B-level Property Manager “Players” into A-level Players or by quickly identifying under-performing employees and then networking/recruiting to find top A-Players that will be hired, trained, and developed with the support, from the recruitment team. title: Presentation Designer
description:
Hill+Knowlton is currently seeking a talented PowerPoint Presentation Designer to create dynamic, eye-catching presentations showcasing ideas to prospective clients and help H+K win new business opportunities. This individual will report to a fun and lean U.S. Business Development team and will be responsible for upholding global brand standards, while designing well thought out PowerPoint presentations and submissions that offer creativity and bold and innovative thinking to deliver on communications objectives. Of note, most presentation submissions are in PowerPoint so design with this program is required.

You will partner with team members on the new business team and another designer to help execute sometimes abstract ideas into creative visuals and pitch materials to assist senior leads in presenting on behalf of the organization. Creatively bringing ideas and execution to life is key through imagery, relevant mock-ups and overall design execution in PPT. This candidate must have the ability to communicate information and data effectively with the use of concept mock-ups well as the creation of easy to understand charts, graphs and diagrams - making it feel digestible and interesting to prospects.

The new business team is extremely agile and works across various sectors including healthcare, consumer goods, energy, government and tech. The Presentation Designer will need to display a range of skills and an ability to adapt to different design styles based on the prospect’s business and ideas presented. We’re looking for an innovative designer who can take initiative and help bring our ideas to life.

This is an opportunity to work at a fast-paced agency, grow your career and see the very best thinking from senior leads engaged in the pitch process. You will have the opportunity to learn about new verticals and PR tactics and work with a driven and dedicated five-person team to liaise across our growing global team.

This position can be based in any of our 12 US offices.

Responsibilities
Working with the teams and business development to ensure that all branded PPT presentations are created to a high standard
Liaising with senior management to create on-brand new business materials, including PPT templates and breaker slides, concept mock-ups, coverage mock-ups, charts, infographics, printed booklets, brochures, boards, etc. (majority of work is in PPT)
Building collateral to communicate creative ideas and agency capabilities
Participating in brainstorms and bringing new ideas to the table
Overseeing freelance design resource as and when applicable
Supporting design for H+K award entries, ads, mailers, marketing materials and digital channels

title: Research Assistant I - Lab-Recruited
description:
Performs laboratory experiments utilizing specific and proscribed techniques and equipment. Collects project data. Under direction, processes, organizes and summarizes data, reporting experiment results using a variety of scientific, word processing, spreadsheet or statistical software applications or program platforms. As a member of a project team, may assist in the design of laboratory experiments, techniques, and protocols. May perform routine logging and or testing of samples. May occasionally instruct others in basic laboratory techniques. Performs related laboratory maintenance such as maintaining and cleaning equipment and ordering supplies. May process orders or invoices, or undertake other clerical and simple accounting duties under the direction of administrative personnel. At least one year related work experience. Relevant course work may count towards experience. Demonstrated abilities in basic laboratory techniques helpful, but not required. Exposure to applicable computer technologies, including specific software applications, may be required. Appropriate communications skills required. May be required to lift, move and transport related laboratory equipment. May be required to work with a variety of hazardous materials. May be required to work with and handle animals. May be required to use Autoclave.

Job Duties
Perform skilled techniques in support of lab’s research goals listed here:
Prepare media for culturing bacterial and insect cells
Maintain, transfer, and establish insect cell culture utilizing aseptic technique
Monitor cultures for contamination by mycoplasma and other bacteria or yeast. This may entail use of sensitive diagnostic kits for detection as well as more simple examination for color change and/or by microscope.
Clone genes for recombinant protein expression including the development of primers, preforming restriction digestion and/or Gibson assembly, and plasmid prep
Preform PCR and DNA sequencing
Purify recombinant proteins via metal affinity and size exclusion chromatography
Validate recombinant protein functionality via biophysical techniques and antibody recognition
Identify protein crystallization conditions using sparse matrix screening and in-house screens
Prepare buffers and SDS-PAGE gels for protein purification and crystallization
Conduct dose-response assays to measure IC50 values for experimental small molecules
Computer based work:
Maintain accurate documentation of experimental protocols and perform mathematical analysis of data including nonlinear regression to determine IC50 values
Analyze diffraction data and solve crystal structures of viral proteins in complex with small molecules
Read scientific literature related to project
Monitor, order, and store all lab supplies.
Primarily responsible for equipment maintenance and monitoring supplies on hand
Interface with vendors as it relates to instrument maintenance
The incumbent will perform skilled techniques that require delicate manipulation and/or fine adjustments. S/He will draw upon previous laboratory experience with the test or equipment to detect if something is wrong with the procedure and may make procedural changes or modify techniques. S/he will be expected to complete general mathematical analysis. This position requires a high level of responsibility and independence. Work is performed routinely without direct supervision, however all work is reviewed and discussed with supervisor.

title: Data Entry Specialist
description:
Power Sales Group is a manufacturer's representative firm specializing in sales of medium-voltage and high-voltage equipment to electric utilities, contractor and industrial accounts, and renewable power in the Northeastern US. We are seeking an Data Entry Specialist to join our company.

title: Pathway Advisor
description:
This is an exciting time to be an advisor at the Community College of Aurora. We are embarking on a redesign of our advising model and pathways advisors will be key contributors to implementing a new model of advising on campus. CCA is a Guided Pathways College, which means that we believe in supporting our students in a seamless experience from the moment they first make contact with us until they reach their academic goal. Pathways Advisors are caring, enthusiastic, hard-working, and passionate staff who are excellent at interacting with students and supporting them in their academic journey. Our Pathways Advisors will work collaboratively with faculty members within the students chosen Guided Academic Pathway. Pathways Advisors and faculty will work together to develop intentional interventions along each student’s pathway that encourage growth and sustain commitment to completing a degree or certificate at CCA. Pathways Advisors will provide proactive academic advising, career advising, financial aid advising, and success coaching for students within specific Guided Academic Pathways. Guided Academic Pathways were established at CCA in the spring of 2017. Pathways advisors will support students by helping them to explore educational and career goals proactively. Pathways advisors will track student academic progression and completion towards a degree and proactively intervene as necessary. Advisors will help current students persist by assisting them in navigating their Academic Course Map, providing transfer information, and making campus and community referrals as needed. Pathway Advisors will also be engaging in basic financial aid and career planning conversations with students, including matching student career interests to courses/programs of study, and being mindful of debt and default management concerns.

Duties & Responsibilities
Assess academic needs and career goals of assigned Guided Academic Pathways students. Help students choose and enter a pathway. Advise new and continuing students regarding completing a credential and/or transferability of degree program.
Provide proactive/case management advising for new degree seeking students. Monitor student academic progress towards a credential and intervene as needed. Utilize resources and methods to promote student retention.
Act as a Guided Academic Pathway liaison with academic departments.
Establish relationships with faculty within assigned Guided Academic Pathway.
Develop relationships with transfer representatives at the top transfer institutions for CCA students. Connect with transfer institutions for assigned Guided Academic Pathway, and remain updated on degree information and transfer requirements.
Help current students persist by assisting them in navigating their Academic Course Map, provide transfer information, and make campus and community referrals as needed.
Engage in basic career planning conversations with students, including matching student career interests to courses/programs of study.
Provide basic financial aid advising including financial literacy, debt, and default management information.
Participate in Guided Academic Pathway events, and other activities that promote and build Guided Academic Pathway communities.
Participate in early alert and support at-risk students, students on academic probation, and students on academic suspension.
Maintain knowledge of the curricula for CCA degrees, certificates, courses and issues relevant to transferring to Colorado four-year institutions, and for career preparation.
Maintain current knowledge of CCA policies and procedures for admissions, enrollment, and completing a program of study.
Utilize available report, tracking, assessment, and communication technologies (specifically EAB Navigate, DegreeWorks, SARS, and in some cases Recruit) to implement proactive advising strategies.
Participate in ALL advising trainings to become and remain skilled in academic advising, intrusive interventions, career advising, and financial aid advising.
Participate in new student orientation, degree check fairs, Connect2CCA and other events that promote the college and support student success as assigned including at night and on weekends.
Performs other duties as assigned.

title: Director Of Food And Beverage
description:
Seeking an experienced and dynamic Director of Food and Beverage for this luxury wellness resort in Arizona. In this position you will lead the food and beverage operation, culinary and event space. You will be responsible for meeting revenue goals and maintain extremely high levels of service.

Qualified candidates must have a minimum of 3 years as a Director and have experience working with luxury independent properties. Seeking candidates that have not jumped around in their career and have a strong understanding of Forbes Five Star service standards. You must be detail oriented, very professional, articulate, and analytical.

title: Director of Operations
description:
We are looking to hire a Director of Operations to oversee Streamline Financial’s operational processes, manage projects, lead our team, and be the heart of everything happening in our organization.

Streamline has been operating for 22 years and we currently manage over $200MM of clients assets. We are a team of 1 Client Service Associate, 1 Administrative Assistant and 4 Financial Planners.

Our mission is to remove the worry that can sometimes come with money and investing. We do this through wise planning principles and incorporating both the emotional and spiritual part of our client's lives when planning for their future.

The Director of Operations will work closely with the leadership team, the advisors, and operations.

Roles & Responsibilities
Manage all office projects
Maintain and improve our processes and system
Lead Team Development and Human Resources Management
Oversee the OSJ/Compliance Duties
Lead Tech and software initiative
Improve client service and office mgmt.
Oversee Meeting Prep & Post Meeting Follow-Up
Spearheading strategies to steer the company’s future in a positive direction.
Preparing timely and accurate performance reports.
Delegating responsibilities to ensure staff members grow as capable participants.
Employing various initiatives to coach employees to optimize their capabilities.
Completing performance reviews in a prudent manner.
Assessing and implementing improved processes and new technologies, and collaborating with management regarding the implementation of these improvements.
